Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Sat Jun 18 05:45:32 2016 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!
No new announcements to display.

web address.

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport
Landing Pad.
You see a long plasteel counter, a pair of narrow bunks, a small seashell pink
trash can, a large oval dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a glossy
sapphire blue ceramic felo chow bowl, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of lavender
silk sheets, a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
turquoise rattan dresser with brass handles and a glass-covered top, and a high
tech silver star print holovid here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a soft
periwinkle cashmere blanket, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple
and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Shower]
This is a very tiny shower. There is no shower head as such, but instead a small
sprayer attached to a hose coming out of the wall, which would work to some
effect even in zero gravity. A thick plastic sheet allows the shower to be
completely sealed off from the outside, with air pumped in overhead and several
grates capturing water to be returned to the ship's recycling system. The status
lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You can go out.

He appears to be 26 years old. He is about six feet and two inches tall and has

average-sized shoulders and a wide chest with small dark nipples. His abdomen is
flat and punctuated by a sunken navel. More intimately, he has bushy salt and
pepper pubic hair and an athletic butt. His face is average-shaped and handsome,
with a broad nose and strong chin. His lips are thin and tan and occasionally
part to reveal a set of fairly white teeth. Beneath a set of arched eyebrows,
his eyes are blue-grey and round. His chin-length, straight hair is blonde and
neatly trimmed over the ears and parted on the side. He has large brownish
fingernails.
 He is wearing nothing. He is also wearing a keychain, a gold wrist-mounted
chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, and a solid silver
ring engraved with dolphins. His head, face, both eyes, neck, both shoulders,
chest, back, both biceps, both elbows, abdomen, both forearms, both wrists, both
hands, waist, both hips, groin, both thighs, both knees, both calves, both
ankles, and both feet are left uncovered.
He is carrying nothing.

no clues concerning your current location within the ship. Running alongside the
wires and conduits is what appears to be a plant, silver with a hint of deep
purple. It looks to be a nearly full-grown tendril, with small, pale purple
flowers.

 You are wearing a long-sleeved blue and white shadow-striped cotton shirt, a
pair of slim blue stone linen trousers, and a pair of gray canvas sneakers.
Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a pair of

in a black leather phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic
silver metachannel FTL communicator, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins,
a black guitar case, and a backpack. You are concealing a leather briefcase, a

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 27
Chainguns:
CIVIL DEFENSE BASIC CHAINGUN (Drydock)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 2 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 12%
Time To Fire: 3s
TENOSQUE DEFENSE ACCELERATED CHAINGUN (New Earth Blazing Trails and New Earth
spaceport)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 4 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 10%
Time To Fire: 3s
CHAMPOTON REGIONAL DEFENSE CHAINGUN (Bikura)
Requirements: 100 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 5 Grid Usage: 13 Hull Accuracy Added: 7%
Time To Fire: 3s
RENEGADE ADAPTED CHAINGUN (Endymion and Old Frontier Processor)
Requirements: 200 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 6.5 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 8%
Time To Fire: 3s
COALITION REPEATING PROJECTILE TURRET MK I (Drydock)
Requirements: 400 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 9 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
Chainguns are components one does not often expect to find on an AEU ship. They
don't hurt the combat grid too badly, and some of them have higher hull bonuses
than any other weapons, but they do have their downsides. Chainguns require
ammunition, and time to reload when the turrets run dry. This will mean you
cannot fire for a certain period of time. Also, without bonuses they do not hit
as hard as the other weapons available to us which means you will likely be
stuck in a battle for a longer time than you might want.

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 17
Rental ships:
As cadets or new pilots, it can be tough getting yourselves assigned to crewed
beacons. You should still try to do so as flying successfully against Outsiders
is not an easy thing without considerable practice. However, if you feel
yourself capable, you can rent one of these ships. You should note however, that
if you get any of these ships destroyed, your rent prices will increase
considerably based on the number of destroyed rental ships you have. Rental
ships all have mid-level upgrades, and most are not as strong as ships that you
can actually purchase yourself. You can try them out by going to Agnarr's
Interstellar Siege Force Rental-in-a-Box in Tannhauser Gate.
One-Person Fighter
ASS-A1 ALLIED STARSHIPS SPACE SUPERIORITY FIGHTER
Class: Fighter
Model number: ASS-A1                    Designation: A.S.S. Fighter
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 1
Standard storage capacity: 6500         Standard battery hours: 3
Docking bay size required: 5
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 120%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 90%
One-person heavy bomber
ASS-A2 ALLIED STARSHIPS HEAVY BOMBER
Class: Fighter
Model number: ASS-A2                    Designation: A.S.S. Bomber
Turret hardpoints: 2                    Launcher hardpoints: 2
Standard storage capacity: 9750         Standard battery hours: 6
Docking bay size required: 5
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 120%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 90%
Two-Person Scout
ASS-B1 ALLIED STARSHIPS DEEP-SPACE SCOUT
Class: Scout
Model number: ASS-B1                    Designation: A.S.S. Scout
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 1
Standard storage capacity: 8000         Standard battery hours: 14
Docking bay size required: 12.5
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 110%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Three-Person Destroyer
ASS-C1 ALLIED STARSHIPS DESTROYER
Class: Destroyer
Model number: ASS-C1                    Designation: A.S.S. Destroyer
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 2
Standard storage capacity: 12000        Standard battery hours: 6
Docking bay size required: 40
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 105%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Five-Person Gunship
ASS-E1 ALLIED STARSHIPS ATTACK GUNSHIP
Class: Gunship
Model number: ASS-E1                    Designation: A.S.S. Gunship
Turret hardpoints: 12                   Launcher hardpoints: 3
Standard storage capacity: 24000        Standard battery hours: 8
Docking bay size required: 60           Docking bay capacity: 25
Class Modifications:
Instantaneous Speed: 95%
Six-Person Frigate
ASS-F1 ALLIED STARSHIPS DEFENSE FRIGATE
Class: Frigate
Model number: ASS-F1                    Designation: A.S.S. Frigate
Turret hardpoints: 12                   Launcher hardpoints: 4
Standard storage capacity: 32000        Standard battery hours: 8
Docking bay size required: 100          Docking bay capacity: 37.5
Class Modifications:
Instantaneous Speed: 95%

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 18
Long-term rentals:
The fighter and heavy bomber listed in this section are generally similar to the
ones rented at Tannhauser, save for the fact that I'm pretty sure they start out
with stock upgrades and have to be upgraded by the long-term renter. The modular
tactical platform and the Modular Terrorerotici both can only have
corporation-based fighters such as the hyperion ships or the ones rented either
short-term or long-term by Agnar attached to them as far as we've deduced, as
well as the shuttles manufactured by corporations such as Hermes or United. You
can attach the ships to the platforms only from space. Note: the docking bay
size of the tactical platform and the Terrorerotici will increase depending on
the types of ships you have attached to them.
One-Person A.S.S. Fighter 2,000,000.00 (Helios Agnarr's Interstellar Siege Force
Long Term Rental)
ASS-A1 ALLIED STARSHIPS SPACE SUPERIORITY FIGHTER
Requirements: 0 industry points
Model number: ASS-A1                    Designation: A.S.S. Fighter
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 1
Standard storage capacity: 6500         Standard battery hours: 3
Docking bay size required: 5
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 120%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 90%
Instantaneous Speed: 105%
One-Person A.S.S. Bomber 15,000,000.00 (Helios Agnarr's Interstellar Siege Force
Long Term Rental)
ASS-A2 ALLIED STARSHIPS HEAVY BOMBER
Requirements: 200 industry points       200 combat points
Model number: ASS-A2                    Designation: A.S.S. Bomber
Turret hardpoints: 2                    Launcher hardpoints: 2
Standard storage capacity: 9750         Standard battery hours: 6
Docking bay size required: 5
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 120%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 90%
Instantaneous Speed: 105%
Three-Person A.S.S. Modular Terrorerotici 250,000,000.00 (Helios Agnarr's
Interstellar Siege Force Long Term Rental)
ASS-C4 ALLIED STARSHIPS BUDGET-CONSTRAINED MODULAR TERROREROTICISM VESSEL
Requirements: 750 industry points       750 combat points
Model number: ASS-C4                    Designation: A.S.S. Modular
Terroreroticist
Turret hardpoints: 0                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 10000        Standard battery hours: 6
Docking bay size required: 35
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 105%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 102%
ASS-E7 ALLIED STARSHIPS MODULAR TACTICAL PLATFORM
Requirements: 1250 industry points      1250 combat points
Model number: ASS-E7                    Designation: A.S.S. Tactical Platform
Turret hardpoints: 0                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 20000        Standard battery hours: 2
Docking bay size required: 50
Class Modifications:
Six-Person A.S.S. Frigate (approval required) (Helios Agnarr's Interstellar
Siege Force Long Term Rental)
ASS-F1 ALLIED STARSHIPS DEFENSE FRIGATE
Requirements: 1000 industry points      1000 combat points
Model number: ASS-F1                    Designation: A.S.S. Frigate
Turret hardpoints: 12                   Launcher hardpoints: 4
Standard storage capacity: 32000        Standard battery hours: 8
Docking bay size required: 100          Docking bay capacity: 37.5
   Class Modifications:
Instantaneous Speed: 95%
If you want to own a six-person ship to do stuff in and don't quite qualify for
the Pincer, then this ship is for you! It has fewer weapons, but would be able
to perform well enough in a fight with decent upgrades. It does however require
you to fill out an application, and approval or denial notifications may take
some time to reach you, but you'll be notified by mail regardless.
[Notification from Starseekers] An asteroid has been received at League Asteroid
Processing Nuclear Temporary Station from the two-person isotope "IceBake". The
organization has earned 289,825.84 credits and 1 megacredit.
A metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator beeps insistently as it receives
a new notice.
read book
An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 18
Long-term rentals:
The fighter and heavy bomber listed in this section are generally similar to the
ones rented at Tannhauser, save for the fact that I'm pretty sure they start out
with stock upgrades and have to be upgraded by the long-term renter. The modular
tactical platform and the Modular Terrorerotici both can only have
corporation-based fighters such as the hyperion ships or the ones rented either
short-term or long-term by Agnar attached to them as far as we've deduced, as
well as the shuttles manufactured by corporations such as Hermes or United. You
can attach the ships to the platforms only from space. Note: the docking bay
size of the tactical platform and the Terrorerotici will increase depending on
the types of ships you have attached to them.
One-Person A.S.S. Fighter 2,000,000.00 (Helios Agnarr's Interstellar Siege Force
Long Term Rental)
ASS-A1 ALLIED STARSHIPS SPACE SUPERIORITY FIGHTER

Instantaneous Speed: 105%

Docking bay size required: 100          Docking bay capacity: 37.5
   Class Modifications:
Instantaneous Speed: 95%
If you want to own a six-person ship to do stuff in and don't quite qualify for
the Pincer, then this ship is for you! It has fewer weapons, but would be able
to perform well enough in a fight with decent upgrades. It does however require
you to fill out an application, and approval or denial notifications may take
some time to reach you, but you'll be notified by mail regardless.

read comm
You glance at your communicator's screen.
Notice from the Voice of the Corps: Good day AEU, We are currently seeking
someone to fill the vacant AEU Ground Squad Leader's position. Although it would
be ideal that someone with advanced-level skills in Ground Combat would assume
this role, since we currently do not have any Cadets or new pilots to instruct,
anyone with Ground Combat knowledge and whom is willing to grow their skills
should at least give consideration to this opportunity. The paperwork is minimal
as well. If you would like to volunteer for the position of Ground Squad Leader,
please notify me in writing and I will submit your name for consideration. -
Lily Kaise. [18:33 27 June 2316 GST]

l
[Starship "Guinea Pig"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers" here.
You can go down and out.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Guinea Pig, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
ftl drydock
A lone outpost glitters in an otherwise nondescript cloud of debris.
sit
You sit down.
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.
move
A large frame hangs in space here, sufficiently large to at least contain a
battlecruiser-class starship.

wait.

cycle
You press a large button marked CYCLE.
The computer announces, "Beginning cycling."
A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.
out
You may not leave the airlock while it is cycling.
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.
out

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 27
Chainguns:
CIVIL DEFENSE BASIC CHAINGUN (Drydock)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 2 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 12%
Time To Fire: 3s
TENOSQUE DEFENSE ACCELERATED CHAINGUN (New Earth Blazing Trails and New Earth
spaceport)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 4 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 10%
Time To Fire: 3s
CHAMPOTON REGIONAL DEFENSE CHAINGUN (Bikura)
Requirements: 100 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 5 Grid Usage: 13 Hull Accuracy Added: 7%
Time To Fire: 3s
RENEGADE ADAPTED CHAINGUN (Endymion and Old Frontier Processor)
Requirements: 200 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 6.5 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 8%
Time To Fire: 3s
COALITION REPEATING PROJECTILE TURRET MK I (Drydock)
Requirements: 400 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 9 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
Chainguns are components one does not often expect to find on an AEU ship. They
don't hurt the combat grid too badly, and some of them have higher hull bonuses
than any other weapons, but they do have their downsides. Chainguns require
ammunition, and time to reload when the turrets run dry. This will mean you
cannot fire for a certain period of time. Also, without bonuses they do not hit
as hard as the other weapons available to us which means you will likely be
stuck in a battle for a longer time than you might want.

l
[Starship "Revenge"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive, a dark gray leather captain's
chair, and a decoy beacon launcher here.
You can go down and out.
out

l
[Starship "Striking Distance"; Weapons Room]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. The status lights
overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in a garage.
You see a swiveling gray leather gunner's chair here.
You can go south and down.

sit chair
You sit up onto a gray leather captain's chair.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
Via general sector communication, Accord of Free Worlds Command transmits,
"Hello, Kalliste. Welcome to Accord space."

from the various starship systems.

l
[Starship "Kalliste"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a gray leather captain's chair here.
You can go south and out.

A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
Dj1?vuJNDW<9&_8u@Fxk7u"bR0?+~cD|F"f>FV{b
move
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The starship is already moving.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
move
The starship is already moving.

Southsoutheast and Slightly Down."

peer out

[League Salvage Processing Debris-Burning Temporary Station; Docking Bay]
A small, basic docking bay is the core of the station, along with the life
support system and resource storage. Small hatches lead to the other station
modules.
The two-person medium transport "Kalliste" is parked here.
You can go north, east, south, up, and down.
[Notification from Starseekers] A load of salvage has been received at League
Salvage Processing Debris-Burning Temporary Station from the two-person medium
transport "Kalliste". The organization has earned 1,422,945.51 credits.
You are charged less in taxes for transferring to a pilot-owned space station.
You have been credited with 5,777,850.77 League credits for your find.
Your income is deferred until the temporary station's storage module is
transferred to a spaceport.
The sounds from the ship's hold cease as the cargo finishes transferring.

1
--
Salvage IFS Wrecks
--
A patrol recently ran into a bunch of IFS ships near Beacon A-45.
The fighting's done, but the people in R&D think there might be something to
salvage from the wrecks.
Head out there and pick up 80,000 units from the wrecks and we'll see what we've
got.
--
changelog
Recent Minor Changes:
-----
The asteroid mining site command 'research' now tells you when the currently
researched building will be completed.
   Posted 4 days, 2 hours, 15 minutes, and 20 seconds ago
-----
Communicator lag has been tackled. It may or may not be solved, but it is
definitely less than it was once before!
   Posted 3 days, 16 hours, 7 minutes, and 27 seconds ago
-----
There is a new general option that allows you to ignore OOC board posts.
   Posted 3 days, 10 hours, 43 minutes, and 44 seconds ago
-----
Even though nobody really wanted this, we have gone ahead and added a shortened
target tracking option to the GENERAL-OPTIONS command. It's what it sounds like.
   Posted 3 days, 7 minutes, and 9 seconds ago
-----
A very illegal (but often asked for) object is now available in Mutuality supply
stores. Its use removes the confirmation prompt on weapons fire.
   Posted 2 days, 19 hours, 53 minutes, and 44 seconds ago
-----
Engineering status will now indicate which weapons rooms have bypass keys, if
any.
   Posted 2 days, 19 hours, 22 minutes, and 55 seconds ago
-----
Alliance Pirates starships now contain 50% more rainbows.
   Posted 22 hours, 2 minutes, and 12 seconds ago
-----

2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
TxMds_-o6|-1reZS(@~z{`}C0YpdmpGql~vru9.%
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

[Notification from Starseekers] A load of salvage has been received at League
Salvage Processing Debris-Burning Temporary Station from the two-person medium
transport "Kalliste". The organization has earned 1,447,764.05 credits.
You are charged less in taxes for transferring to a pilot-owned space station.
You have donated two pieces of debris to the station's blast furnace.
You have been credited with 5,878,626.11 League credits for your find.
Your income is deferred until the temporary station's storage module is
transferred to a spaceport.

A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
The starship is already moving.
move
The starship is already moving.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

wait.

l
[Starship "Kalliste"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Accord of Free Worlds Command; Docking Bay
One.
You see a gray leather captain's chair here.
You can go south and out.
launch
The navigation systems are nonfunctional until their power is restored.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
Flight control gives the ship launch clearance.
ftl c-15
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
Via general sector communication, Beacon C-15 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Kalliste.' Welcome to Beacon C-15."

l
[Starship "Kalliste"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a gray leather captain's chair here.
You can go south and out.

[1] The Shoulder of Orion (Unclaimed)
[2] The Belt of Orion (Unclaimed)
Enter your selection:
2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
<*k_V%/W]TM-6<B)zr/k8BrId=cMAg)<B[Pcg#?|
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.

armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

request
You stop in the middle of the room, glancing at each potential passenger with a
discerning eye. The passengers immediately take note of your bearing and rise to
their feet as one, instantly surrounding you and each clamoring for attention.

to Candelaria Orbital Skunkworks in Candelaria Orbit! You must take me as a
passenger!" [1 passengers]

patient is dying! We need to get him to Meredith in Cardenas Orbit as quickly as
possible. Can you help us?" [5 passengers]

our tour group? Aren't we supposed to be at Tikal in Tikal Orbit by now? I think
we need to hire a starship. Wait... Betty? Has anyone seen Betty? Betty? Betty?
She's... she's gone..." [8 passengers]

passengers]

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

[Teslatown; Faraday Plaza] (inside a battlesuit)
Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.
You see a silver-haired Tesla scientist here.
You can go east, southwest, west, and northwest.

[Site 148568144; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

[Site 148568144; Tunnel] (inside a battlesuit)
This is a large dark tunnel, exactly like the hundreds of others that permeate
this world. The stone above blocks some of the incoming radiation, but the heat
level increases quickly as the tunnels wind into the depths of the planet.

[Site 155334641; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

Notice from the Voice of the Corps: As of this notice, one volunteer has
submitted their name to assume the AEU Ground Squad Leader vacancy. I will allow
another 24 hours or until midnight on June 29th for others to submit their names
in writing for consideration. If there are more than one who express their
willingness to serve, then we can vote on those individuals. If one name remains
as the only submission, then I will present it to the Liaison Office for their
decision. [23:56 27 June 2316 GST]

l me
Shule Elemmire
He appears to be 26 years old. He is about six feet and two inches tall and has
olive skin. His body is athletic with muscled hips and strong calves. He has
average-sized shoulders and a wide chest. His face is average-shaped and
handsome, with a broad nose and strong chin. His lips are thin and tan and
occasionally part to reveal a set of fairly white teeth. Beneath a set of arched
eyebrows, his eyes are blue-grey and round. His chin-length, straight hair is
blonde and neatly trimmed over the ears and parted on the side.
 He is wearing a gold spacesuit helmet, a black spacesuit top with a red star on
the right shoulder, a pair of black spacesuit gloves with a gold stripe around
each cuff, a black spacesuit bottom with a red stripe down the outside of each
leg, and a pair of black spacesuit boots with a gold stripe down each side. He
is also wearing a keychain, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather
phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel
FTL communicator, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, a black guitar
case, a backpack, a reactionless spacesuit jet, and a spacesuit navaid. His
face, both eyes, and neck are left uncovered.
He is carrying nothing.

l
[Starship "Israel Hope"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a large leather couch, and a polished
rosewood bar here.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "Israel Hope"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.

[1] The Shoulder of Orion (Unclaimed)
[2] The Belt of Orion (Unclaimed)
Enter your selection:
2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
.e|UFZ1IY}eT!bXmfhvK<U\Tvy~]b:KlB;YBQRZK
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

Starships In Sector:

never to be seen again.

let's put you back."

space.

l EAOS
an EAOS Alchemist
This is a slim, almost delicate-looking battlesuit, painted dark silver all
over. It resembles some sort of large humanoid robot. A slim cockpit encases the
pilot's torso, while the pilot's arms and legs extend into a framework of
hydraulics and cables with some protective plating. A large plasma cannon is
mounted to the left forearm, a neutronium-laced metal tube leading to a large
tank on the back of the suit. A laser attachment is mounted to the right wrist.
A large subsonic projector is mounted to the left shoulder.
It appears to be 0% damaged.
You feel a slight bump as the aerial fortress detaches from "Daisy May."
You hold yourself steady against the sudden thrust as the aerial fortress fires
its descent thrusters.
Damien Alexander presses a prominent button, and a crane promptly retrieves a
Mutuality Jack-of-all-Trades from storage and sets it in front of him.
An assembly of robotic arms descends from the ceilings, rapidly reloading the
battlesuit's weapons.
The rumble of thrust eases off as the aerial fortress achieves a hovering
position near the space station's docking bay.

lauch

launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[Ventilation Tunnels; Entry Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This appears to be an access point to a space station's large ventilation
system. Though, saying that, it doesn't appear quite large enough for a
battlesuit, and the presence of the heavy powered armor appears to be distending
the metal somewhat. But anything is better than a ventilation system filled with
giant bugs and mold!
You can go east.
A drop pod suddenly hurtles into the area, slowing its descent abruptly with a
burst of thrust, then hitting the ground and immediately peeling open, revealing
Damien Alexander (Mutuality Jack-of-all-Trades).

l demarco
Demarco Scott (AEU Utility Combatant)
This is a fairly light battlesuit, painted dark green with silver trim. It
resembles some sort of large humanoid robot. A slim cockpit encases the pilot's
torso, while the pilot's arms and legs extend into a framework of hydraulics and
cables with some protective plating. A minidrone applicator is attached to the
left wrist, a hose leading to a bulky device on the back of the suit. A laser
attachment is mounted to the right wrist. A large subsonic projector is mounted
to the left shoulder.
It appears to be 0% damaged.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.

[Ventilation Tunnels; T-Junction] (inside a battlesuit)
Here, a straight tunnel branches into two alternatives. One can go that way, or
one can go that other way. The possibilities are endless!
You see the corpse of Bari Worker Horde Alpha, Lily Kaise (League Paladin),
Damien Alexander (Mutuality Jack-of-all-Trades), and Demarco Scott (AEU Utility
Combatant) here.
You can go north, east, and south.
peer e
You peer east...
[Ventilation Tunnels; Four-Way Junction] (inside a battlesuit)
Here, a single straight tunnel intersects with another straight tunnel. Through
the magic of topology, this intersection of two things actually creates four
equally exciting paths!
You see Bari Worker Horde Alpha here.
You can go north, east, south, and west.
Demarco Scott says to the corpse of Bari Worker Horde Alpha, "Screech at that,
bitch."
Lily Kaise laughs.
peer w
You peer west but see nothing of interest.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You can go south and west.
Demarco Scott says in a Bikuran accent, "Got it."
Lily Kaise moves north.
n
Damien Alexander moves north.
You move north.

one can go that other way. The possibilities are endless!

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You can go east and south.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Four-Way Junction] (inside a battlesuit)
Here, a single straight tunnel intersects with another straight tunnel. Through
the magic of topology, this intersection of two things actually creates four
equally exciting paths!

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You can go north and south.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You can go north and south.

   You, Damien Alexander (Mutuality Jack-of-all-Trades), Demarco Scott (AEU
Utility Combatant), and Lily Kaise (League Paladin) are rapidly repaired by a
swarm of minidrones!

you."

You see a small yellow ball containing some rattling beads, a silky purple

ceramic felo chow bowl, an overstuffed sofa upholstered in brilliantly colored
patchwork fabric with a sleeping big red soldier felo and a sleeping big green
cyclops felo on it, a large oval white and light yellow cloth rug, Emmylou the
humanoid service robot, a hefty green soldier felo kitten, a large green cyclops

bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

fer the processor."
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

Welcome to home space!"

commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
ca.....................................................Cylinder Accelerator
f......................................................Powered Shotgun
y......................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dis....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
fl.....................................................Flare              
(Attracts attention from a group of enemies.)
fls....................................................Flash              
(Startles an enemy with a bright flash of light, often causing them to stop what
they were doing.)
ill....................................................Illuminate         
(Allows your squad to hit more vital parts of the enemy, increasing damage.)
rad....................................................Radiate            
(Radiates light over your battlesuit, causing the enemy to misdirect some
damage, effectively increasing armor.)
lg.....................................................Laser Guidance     
(Augments your squad's accuracy.)
bl.....................................................Blind              
(Blinds a single target for a period of time.)
df.....................................................Directed Flare     
(Irritates and provokes a single target.)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
det....................................................Detonator          
(detonator)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)
Do you want to edit your command aliases?
[Enter `yes' or `no']

l
[Starship "Daisy May"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on red alert. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is
in space.
You see a temporary wormhole drive, a crudely hammered scrap metal feeding
trough, a hefty green twin tailed felo, and a large octarine soldier felo kitten
here.
You can go north and south.
damage
Starship Damage:
Turret 1: 25%.
Hull damage failsafes remaining: 25%, 50%, 75%, and 97%
You hear a loud bang above you somewhere as ship systems are repaired outside.

deploy

from storage and sets it in front of you.

enter
You press a button on a League Knight, which splits open down the front. You
carefully climb inside.
launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[RATS Nest; Drop Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This is just inside a location where the nest is open to space. Before you
extends a series of tunnels, which are strangely organic-looking, yet clearly
crafted from metal.
You can go southwest.

You peer southwest...
[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You see Overseeing Replicating Kinetic Sentinel Alpha here.
You can go northeast and southwest.

burst of thrust, then hitting the ground and immediately peeling open, revealing
Lily Kaise (Fringe Man-At-Arms).

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

The aerial fortress suddenly fires its ascent thrusters, rocketing toward open
space.
Damien Alexander says into the PA microphone, "That seems like a long time."
pa And I may need repairs before then.
You speak into the microphone.
The vibrations of ascent start to ease off slightly as the aerial fortress
leaves the entrance area.
Lily Kaise's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "Well i'm approximating
but the first mice shoudl be down or slose to it."
Demarco Scott's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "Got it."
You hear odd clanking sounds as the aerial fortress begins repairs.
Demarco Scott emerges from the lift.
Fabious the arachnoid security robot skitters in after Demarco Scott.
At the top of its ascent, the aerial fortress gently comes into contact with
"Daisy May" and the docking clamps snap into place.
Damien Alexander sighs.
Demarco Scott moves up through the starship access tunnel.
Fabious the arachnoid security robot skitters after Demarco Scott.
sigh
You sigh.
Damien Alexander asks in a Tenosque accent, "What about yer damage suit?"
Damien Alexander shrugs.
The sounds of the aerial fortress's repairs abruptly cease.
Lily Kaise emerges from the lift.
'The first nest I've lead in a while and blown up.
You say, "The first nest I've lead in a while and blown up."
'damn
You say, "Damn."
Lily Kaise hugs you.
Damien Alexander pats you on the back.
Lily says to you in a New Earth accent, "Not your fault."

[Aerial Fortress "Petunia"; Deployment]
You see an AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour here.
Damien Alexander is standing here.
You can go north, northeast, and northwest.
Lily Kaise's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "Ouch major."
deploy
You press a prominent button, and a crane promptly retrieves a League Knight
from storage and sets it in front of you.
An assembly of robotic arms descends from the ceilings, rapidly reloading the
battlesuit's weapons.
Demarco Scott's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "Najor."
Damien Alexander presses a button on an AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour,
which splits open down the front. He carefully climbs inside.
Demarco Scott strides in from the north.
Fabious the arachnoid security robot skitters in after Demarco Scott.
Demarco Scott presses a prominent button, and a crane promptly retrieves an AEU
Utility Combatant from storage and sets it in front of him.
An assembly of robotic arms descends from the ceilings, rapidly reloading the
battlesuit's weapons.
enter
You press a button on a League Knight, which splits open down the front. You
carefully climb inside.
Lily Kaise glides in from the north.
launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[RATS Nest; Drop Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This is just inside a location where the nest is open to space. Before you
extends a series of tunnels, which are strangely organic-looking, yet clearly
crafted from metal.
You can go southwest.
A drop pod suddenly hurtles into the area, slowing its descent abruptly with a
burst of thrust, then hitting the ground and immediately peeling open, revealing
Damien Alexander (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour).
A drop pod suddenly hurtles into the area, slowing its descent abruptly with a
burst of thrust, then hitting the ground and immediately peeling open, revealing
Demarco Scott (AEU Utility Combatant).
peer sw
You peer southwest...
[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You see Overseeing Replicating Kinetic Sentinel Alpha here.
You can go northeast and southwest.
A drop pod suddenly hurtles into the area, slowing its descent abruptly with a
burst of thrust, then hitting the ground and immediately peeling open, revealing
Lily Kaise (Fringe Man-At-Arms).

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.
You see Miniaturized Interfacing Companion Entity Alpha, Miniaturized
Interfacing Companion Entity Beta, and Mining Oxidizing-Liquid Entity Gamma
here.
You can go north and south.

peer lounge
You peer into a transparisteel doorway into the pilot lounge...
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
You can go out.
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Demarco Scott transmits, "Get new supplies
anyways."
Lily Kaise glides in from the west.
Lily Kaise says to you in a New Earth accent, "You have a key."
Lily Kaise laughs.
A sanitation drone lumbers into the area.
A sanitation drone turns and slowly plods down.
'I know
You say, "I know."
A sanitation drone slips a white glove onto a mechanical hand and rubs a finger
along a horizontal surface, then studies the result.

[Aerial Fortress "Petunia"; Deployment]

enter

launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[RATS Nest; Drop Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This is just inside a location where the nest is open to space. Before you
extends a series of tunnels, which are strangely organic-looking, yet clearly
crafted from metal.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You see Overseeing Replicating Kinetic Sentinel Alpha here.
You can go east and west.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.
You see Overseeing Replicating Kinetic Sentinel Alpha and Mining Oxidizing-Liqui
d Entity Beta here.
You can go northeast and southwest.
You suffer 35 damage from RATS Greater Rock-eating Acid Spray and RATS
Rock-eating Acid Spray!

fires!
   You are hit!
   You take 38 damage!
      WARNING: Damage level now exceeds 40%.
You're still in the fray! You try to figure out the best escape route.

[Starship "Daisy May"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a small yellow ball containing some rattling beads, a silky purple
cushion decorated with embroidered pale purple lotus blossoms, a glossy gold
ceramic felo chow bowl, an overstuffed sofa upholstered in brilliantly colored
patchwork fabric, a large oval white and light yellow cloth rug, Emmylou the
humanoid service robot, a hefty octarine soldier felo, and Fabious the arachnoid
security robot here.
Demarco Scott is sleeping on the floor.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go south and out.
Lily Kaise's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "Damien are you aboard?"
You wince as an extremely loud metallic bang emanates from outside the ship.
Damien Alexander's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "I'm here."
Lily Kaise's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "Ok."
Small clinks of metal come from the hull of the ship as it's being repaired.

l damien
Damien Alexander
He appears to be 32 years old. He is about six feet and one inch tall and has
tan skin. His body is athletic with average-shaped hips and well-muscled calves.
He has sloping shoulders and an averagely built chest. His face is narrow and
subtly asymmetrical, with a sharp nose and strong chin. His lips are thin and
beige and occasionally part to reveal a set of fairly white teeth. Beneath a set
of dark eyebrows, his eyes are blue-grey and average-shaped. His ear-length,
straight hair is gold with dark metallic purple highlights and mostly unkempt
but standing on end down the middle in a faux hawk. He also has gold stubble. He
has oval clear fingernails. He has several dark red cardinal feathers hanging
from a length of braided ash brown leather in his hair.
A small enameled crimson fist pierces his left earlobe, a small enameled mystic
purple skull pierces his right earlobe, an old titanium ring engraved with a row
of tiny chainguns pierces his right upper ear, and a thick stainless steel ring
with a dolphin charm pierces his left upper ear.
 He is wearing a black flame print bowling shirt, a pair of loose-fitting faded
blue jean cut-offs, and a pair of indigo canvas sneakers. He is also wearing a
wrist-mounted chronometer, an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around
his wrist, an indigo slider einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a solid
silver ring engraved with dolphins, a vibro-baton, and a gunmetal gray canvas
messenger bag. His head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both
wrists, both hands, both knees, both calves, and both ankles are left uncovered.
He is carrying nothing.

fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.

enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.

and v-neck trimmed with tiny embroidered flowers, a pair of lowrise white capri

orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of
tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker,
Purr the humanoid service robot, and a high tech silver star print holovid here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on Shule Elemmire's lap.

blonde and swept up into a thick fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval
pink fingernails.

cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe, and a small enameled cerulean

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.

Landing Pad.

l
[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

General Information
  Purpose:            When the hard work of the day is done, and you are looking
for a place to meet friends. When things become boring and you can't wait to see
something new. Then there is Starseekers, a cool, relaxing place to hang out,
meet old and new friends, and experience something new. Every pilot who believes
there's more to life than points and credits will be welcome here!

l
[Starship "Guinea Pig"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers" here.
You can go down and out.

You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor

drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and

org
--
Starseekers
--
General Information
  Purpose:            When the hard work of the day is done, and you are looking
for a place to meet friends. When things become boring and you can't wait to see
something new. Then there is Starseekers, a cool, relaxing place to hang out,
meet old and new friends, and experience something new. Every pilot who believes
there's more to life than points and credits will be welcome here!
  Slogan:             "There's always something new beyond the next star."
  Founder:             Kim Saunders
  Trustees:            Angel Martin and Shule Elemmire
  Members:             11
  Total Members:       14
  Total Active:        9
  Founded on:          22 May 2312
  Public:              Yes
  Recruiting:          No
Unity
  Member Alliances:    AEU, League, and Fringe
  Unity:               78%
Assets
  Credits on Hand:     61,670,094,229.60 EAOS credits
  Starship Insurance:  178,471,363.84 EAOS credits
  Support Fund:        91,111,110.00 EAOS credits
  Starships Owned:     23
  Starships Supported: 2 of 14
  Support Cost:        160,000,000.00 EAOS credits
  Megacredits:         1010
  Member Megacredits:  300
Progress
  Industry:            7338
  Space Combat:        3470
  Ground Combat:       1712
  Exploration:         2627
  Command:             6926
--

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The two-person Accord gemini "Starseekers' Gem" is landed here.

of the room. Upon it is a clear oval-shaped shell, which contains an alien plant
with purple flowers.

reminiscent of metal.

l
[Space Market]
This is an orbital marketplace, connected to others like it through a series of
wormhole shunts. These same wormholes are the reason such marketplaces are not
allowed to operate on planets or large space stations. A computer interface
provides access to buying and selling on the marketplace, and a large chute
underneath it allows items to emerge as they are delivered via wormhole.
The vostok-class capsule "Shooting Star" is parked here.
You see a sanitation drone here.
You can go southeast, south, and southwest.

a black engineering tool case

n
Please enter the name of the sector you would like to travel to.
[Type a line of input or `@abort' to abort the command.]
accord
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
The motion of the ship throws your body from side to side, but your seatbelt
holds you in place.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

l
[Accord of Free Worlds; Service Ring]
A large transparisteel window is on the station's starboard side here, as tall
as both main rings together. The transparisteel is slightly darkened, both
polarized and reinforced with some other material, perhaps even trace
neutronium. The bulkheads and deck are made of a darkened, glossy metal, though
not as dark as the station's exterior. Emergency lights are mounted every three
meters overhead. Light blue trim where the bulkheads meet the deck indicate that
this is the Service Deck.
You can go north, south, and west.

[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
Even though this starship garage smells like machine oil and heavy lubricants,
it is spacious and well-lit. Massive hydraulic systems raise and lower starships
to and from the landing pad above, and technicians and mechanics in silvery gray
coveralls ensure that everything keeps running smoothly. A well-lit stairway
which leads to the pilot's lounge is here.
You can go up.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker,
Purr the humanoid service robot, and a small fragrant cone of incense here.
You can go south and out.
