l
[Starship "Davion James"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You can go up and down.

l locker
a red storage locker
This is a standard locker. On its face are a number of buttons, as well as a
fingerprint reader. You can EMPTY the locker in one stroke, or remove each item
individually. If you remove all objects from the locker, either by EMPTYing it
or by removing them individually, the locker will lock itself and you will need
to rent another.
It is open.
It is empty.

[Starship "Israel Hope"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a white four poster rattan bed with a fan-shaped headboard with a white
cotton bedsheet, a blue flannel blanket, a floral pattern cotton pillow, and a
blue cotton pillow on it and a mahogany rattan dresser with brass handles and a
glass-covered top here.

 You are wearing a short-sleeved blue and white shadow-striped cotton shirt, a
pair of slim navy blue linen trousers, and a pair of washed light khaki canvas
sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a
pair of black socks. You are also wearing a keychain, a metallic gold touch
einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a
metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a solid silver ring engraved with
dolphins, a black guitar case, and a backpack. You are concealing a leather
briefcase, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black flightbag with a red shooting
star on the side, a camera bag, an asteroid hauling supply kit, a flight control
scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a black engineering
tool case, a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets, and a scorched
metal thigh holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both
forearms, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.

[New Earth; Spaceport Souvenir Store]
This store is small but packed with items of value to AEU citizens and pilots.
Amid a scattering of pretty green ferns, several rows of finely finished wrought
iron shelves are stocked with t-shirts, keychains, training outfits, and other
memorabilia in the AEU silver and green.
You can go out.
out
[New Earth; Dome]
You can go down.
l
[New Earth; Dome]
Centered on top of the spaceport, this area is spacious and softly lit. The
tinted transparisteel dome overhead affords a view of New Earth's sky, and the
large circular opening in the walkway allows one to look down on the center of
the spaceport below. Even though hallways to the east and west are still blocked
off by barriers because of continuing construction there, a scattering of lush
ferns and an arrangement of a comfortably padded couch and armchair upholstered
in silver gray leather, with a polished Velourian oak table between them,
invites one to linger. Near the escalator is a small souvenir store, its
entrance decorated with an arch of fancy wrought iron.
You can go down.

l
[Starship "Israel Hope"; "Dealbreaker"]]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. The status lights
overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in a garage.
You can go west.

metal thigh holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both
forearms, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.

read letter
--
Shule, yeah I told you I wouldn't be long which if you'd have thought it
important enough, you would have waited as you know that if we do our beacons as
an alliance that they obviously count for the alliance. But nooo you were too
impatient to wait perhaps a half hour and I wasn't even dozing that long. I sat
around all that time too patiently and thinking I was being nice to support you.
I guess too I'm just your squeeze whenever Shule Elemmire wants her. Honest if
wither of you would have said the same, unless I was on a very tight schedule,
I'd have accomodated you. Alas, it's obvious that I expect too much.
--

[Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay]
The hydraulics for the airlocks lining the long side of this spacious docking
bay run quietly and efficiently, transporting each newly docked ship to an
individual berth outlined with square white lights above and below. The nearly
seamless walls and floor are constructed of light gray metal with signs and
hatchways accented in dark green. Though few people are about, it seems a very
well built and maintained station.
The vostok-class capsule "Shooting Star" is landed here.

 Welcome back to Star Conquest!
**
 Star Conquest takes a lot of money to run. Please consider donating to offset
those costs.
 Type HELP DONATIONS for more information.

 TIP: Have a party in your pilots' lounge once in a while. You'll definitely
feel inspired to earn more points afterward!

l
[Old Frontier Processor; Asteroid Mining]
This room appears to be a control center from which one can control drone
operations at remote mining sites. There appear to be several dents in the wall.
You see a large leather couch, a coffee table of highly polished lunar basalt,
and a small natural golden brown trash bin here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a large leather couch.
You can go north.
(You are sitting on a large leather couch.)
l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a sleeveless buttercup yellow cotton top with a v-neck and a row
of tiny embroidered flowers at the edges, a pair of blue stonewashed denim jeans
with a small dark red 'XX' embroidered on the left front pocket, and a pair of
shiny buttercup yellow patent leather clogs. She is also wearing an orange and
white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny
tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer,
a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire
and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a
metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, a neon pink vibro-baton, and a
soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both
eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and both hands are left
uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.
stand
You stand up from a large leather couch.
kiss lily
You kiss Lily Kaise.

sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a

einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a

tool case, a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets, and a scorched
metal thigh holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both
forearms, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

Star! Welcome to home space!"

l
[Starship "Shooting Star"; Control Capsule]
This small capsule is only large enough for one person. A single flight seat
molds itself to the form of its occupant, helping to ease the burden of
acceleration along with a rather underpowered artificial gravity dampening
system. The capsule's inner workings extend into the flight cabin, with the
starship's main computer right up against the back of the seat. A rather sparse
flight control board is presented claustrophobically close to the pilot's face.
It seems to lack any sort of manual control, allowing only automatic flight
profiles to be entered into an antiquated flight computer. It does, however,
possess controls to operate a single small turret. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad. The hatch appears to be locked.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go out.
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
launch
The navigation systems are nonfunctional until their power is restored.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
ftl luna
You must launch before using the FTL drive.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Shooting Star, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
ftl luna
Earthgate Station dominates space here, acting as a watchpost for the approach
to Old Earth.
Old Earth turns below you, blue and green and brown and white. The planet
elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never
actually set foot on it.

[Luna; Apollo Road]
This part of Apollo Road tops a small hill. From here you have a good view of
Luna's new spaceport to the south and of the crater Copernicus all around. The
road here is well-traveled and well-lit, providing ample illumination during
Luna's two-week-long nights. A few shops stand on either side, among them an
over-decorated bar called Lady Luna. The road continues to the north, toward an
area where a lot of new construction is taking place.
You see a sanitation drone here.
You can go north and south.

3. A rift-capable ship becomes separated from the ship containing your

[Type a line of input or `@abort' to abort the command.]

[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Kim Saunders transmits, "Hi Lily."
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Lily Kaise transmits, "I got pretty dozey over
here on Old Frontier Processor. Must be something lulling in that equipment."
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Kim Saunders transmits, "This mining can be
very relaxing, that is for sure."
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Demarco Scott transmits, "Indeed."
First, I would sweep the hyper cast in the approximate direction of the last
ships known location, slowly increasing power until I had either felt they
were out of range or Im able to contact them. If Im not able to contact
them quickly, I would head in their direction and still use the hyper cast to
attempt to make contact. As a last resort, I would send out an active ping, but
since it can be extremely dangerous to do so, I would only do so if I had no
other choice.

the last ships known location, slowly increasing power until I had either
felt they were out of range or Im able to contact them. If Im not able to
contact them quickly, I would head in their direction and still use the hyper
cast to attempt to make contact. As a last resort, I would send out an active
ping, but since it can be extremely dangerous to do so, I would only do so if I
had no other choice.

expedition. I would not want to waste the time and energy put into planning and
organising, preparing, and ultimately carrying out the expedition.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.

help communicator
--
Star Conquest Help: Metachannel Communicators
--
Category: Communication
--
Each character starts the game possessing a metachannel FTL communicator. This
allows people to transmit on the set of channels viewable only by their alliance
as well as the Tactical and General channels, open to all alliances. Also, the
Newbie channel is available through this device.
To use them, the following commands are used.  (Please note that you must be
wearing the communicator and it must be on.  It must also be YOUR communicator. 
Do not give your communicator to another player, or swap it.  This will stop the
communicators working, as they are assigned to the person in question both ICly
and OOCly.)
To turn the communicator on and off completely, the command TURN COMM is used.
To turn the Newbie channel on or off, NEWB COMM is used.
To turn the General channel on and off, GEN COMM is used.
To turn the Tactical channel on and off, TAC COMM is used.
To transmit on the Newbie channel, use the command TRANSMIT NEWBIE message (this
can be shortened to TRA NEWB message)
Example: TRA NEWB How do I communicate with people?
Result: [Newbie Help] Cameron Jellas transmits, "How do I communicate with
people?"
To transmit on the General channel, use the command TRANSMIT GENERAL message 
(this can be shortened to TRA GEN message)
Example: TRA GEN Hello.
Result: [General Communication] Darla Kinnington transmits, "Hello."
To transmit on the Tactical channel, use the command TRANSMIT TACTICAL message
(this can be shortened to TRA TAC message)
Example: TRA TAC There are Battle Thralls in sector 26!
Result: [Tactical Communication] Ella Lerini transmits, "There are Battle
Thralls in sector 26!"
The channels specific to your alliance are slightly different.
You can TUNE COMM TO NUMBER, where NUMBER is a channel number from 1 to 10, to
transmit on that channel using the command TRA message.
Example: TUNE COMM TO 1
Result: You tune a metachannel communicator to ALLIANCE | Channel 1.
Example: TRA Hello.
Result: [ALLIANCE | Channel 1] Faye Masters transmits, "Hello."
You can also TUNE COMM TO 0 (the number zero) which puts the communicator in
tuner mode, allowing you to hear transmissions on all of your alliance channels.
 However, this means that the command to transmit to those channels is slightly
different.  Since the comm is no longer tuned to a specific channel, you must
specify the particular channel number you wish to transmit to.
Example: TUNE COMM TO 0
Result: You tune a metachannel communicator to the ALLIANCE tuner.
Example: TRA 1 Hello.
Result: [ALLIANCE | Channel 1] Georgina Norrington transmits, "Hello."
You can also use social commands with your communicator by simply transmitting
the command, or emotes by transmitting a normal emote command.
Example: TRA GEN laugh
Result: [General Communication] Darla Kinnington laughs.
Example: TRA GEN :snorts and then laughs.
Result: [General Communication] Darla Kinnington snorts and then laughs.
Note that your character is physically speaking into the communicator -- anyone
in the room with you will hear any transmission made by you.
If you wish to have a private conversation with someone, your character will
need a device called an einrophone.
--
help channel
--
Star Conquest Help: Channels
--
Category: Beginner Information
--
The pilot leagues each have access to several specific FTL communication
channels for their alliances, in addition to generic interalliance channels that
can be used by all.
The currently available channels open to all alliances are:
GENERAL COMMUNICATION
'TRA GEN [message]'
The primary interalliance channel, usable by any pilot from any alliance, as
well as certain elements of alliance governments.
TACTICAL COMMUNICATION
'TRA TAC [message]'
An encrypted channel again usable by any pilot from any alliance, this channel
tends to be used to give invasion warnings, reports of unusual events, and
discussions of a nature that should not be made public by the leagues.
NEWBIE HELP
'TRA NEW [message]'
A vaguely OOC channel that exists only to allow new players to ask questions
they could not otherwise ask on other channels due to the OOC nature of them,
such as how to do things that ICly the character should know.
The currently available channels specific to alliances are listed below.  To
transmit on a channel, either tune your communicator to a specific channel (such
as TUNE COMM TO 1, to tune it to Alliance Communication, and use TRA [message]
to speak on it, or TUNE COMM TO 0 to set your comm to the tuner, and use TRA 1
[message] for Alliance Communication, TRA 2 [message] for Distress, etc.)
CHANNEL 1 = ALLIANCE COMMUNICATION
This is the primary alliance-specific channel, used by most pilots to speak with
other members of their alliance's pilot league.
CHANNEL 2 = TACTICAL
This channel is, as the name implies, for tactical discussion, emergency
responses and so on.
CHANNEL 3 = TRADE INFORMATION
This channel is for trade-related discussion or requests.
CHANNEL 4 = SECTOR STATUS
This channel is for information relating to the status of all sectors controlled
by your alliance.
CHANNEL 9 = RADIO CHANNELS
These channels, slightly different for each alliance, are radio channels,
specific to each alliance.
CHANNEL 10 = CONQUEST STATUS
This channel is used to periodically determine the alliance's current Conquest
status.
Channels 5, 6, 7 and 8 are currently not used for specific purposes, but are

[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
Lily Kaise and Joel Kringle are standing here.
You can go out.
Joel Kringle says in a southern California accent, "Getting dressed is
difficult."

You chuckle.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
The two-person Accord gemini "Gtr Beni Gittiin Yere" is landed here.

[Starship "Critical Strike"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.
You see an overstuffed red chair and a steel plaque engraved with the phrase
"Please only use lasers unless otherwise directed. Thank you." here.

You peer south...
[Starship "Critical Strike"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on red alert. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is
in space.
You see an overstuffed red chair, an improved temporary wormhole drive, and Lily
Kaise's workbench here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on an overstuffed red chair.
You can go north and south.

l
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, a shiny chrome trash bin, and Fabious the arachnoid security robot
here.
Akira Kazama, Demarco Scott, Joel Kringle, Evangeline Adaire, Damien Alexander,
Ali Candan, and Lily Kaise are standing here.
You can go out.
A sanitation drone lumbers into the area.
A technician wanders in, orders a cup of coffee, then hurries back out with the
steaming beverage.

[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
Joel Kringle is sitting comfortably on a slim and fashionable couch.
You can go out.

l
[Starship "Supernova"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole
drive tracer, an overstuffed black sofa, a fuzzy stuffed bear, and Fabious the
arachnoid security robot here.
Demarco Scott and Evangeline Adaire are standing here.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "Supernova"; Weapons Room Two]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.

l
[Starship "Supernova"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole
drive tracer, an overstuffed black sofa, a fuzzy stuffed bear, and Fabious the
arachnoid security robot here.
Lily Kaise and Demarco Scott are standing here.
You can go south and out.
[General Communication] Evangeline Adaire transmits, "Hey."
Ali Candan strides in from the south.
[General Communication] Robert O'Malley transmits, "Heya, Joel Kringle. And
heya, Evenia."
Demarco Scott says in a Bikuran accent, "That may take a while, but sure. I hope
it works, we could use someone."
Ali Candan smiles.
Ali Candan says in a Turkish accent, "Thanks."
[General Communication] Damien Alexander transmits, "Okay, Eva, what'm I makin'
for ya again?"

[Starship "Supernova"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole
drive tracer, an overstuffed black sofa, a fuzzy stuffed bear, and Fabious the
arachnoid security robot here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on an overstuffed black sofa. Demarco Scott is standing
here.
You can go south and out.

l demarco
Demarco Scott
He appears to be 29 years old. He is about six feet and six inches tall and has
fair skin. His body is full-figured with muscled hips and well-muscled calves.
He has rounded shoulders and an averagely built chest. His face is round and
unblemished, with an average nose and long chin. His lips are full and
occasionally part to reveal a set of white teeth. Beneath a set of expressive
eyebrows, his eyes are blue and round. His chin-length, straight hair is blonde
and unstyled. He also has a chest-length platinum blonde unstyled beard.
 He is wearing a snug long-sleeved dark purple pullover shirt of heavy cotton
with pockets on the upper arms and steel-eyelet webbing across the chest and a
pair of low rise black cotton cargo pants with a lot of pockets and loosened
straps on the outside of each leg. He is also wearing a message board reader, a
portable newsfeed aggregator, an alliance information assistant, a personal
filing computer, a standard starship flightbag, a flight control scanner, a
metafrequency FTL transmitter, a metachannel FTL communicator and watch, a
hand-made bracelet of tiny pinecones and polished coffee beans, a charcoal gray
leather gadget bag, a red engineering tool case, a large blue canvas carrying
pack, a compact metallic sapphire blue camera with a gold fleur-de-lys embossed
on the front with a glittery royal blue camera strap, a royal blue fleur-de-lys
keyring, a shimmering necklace of small crimson beads around his neck, a
shimmering necklace of small emerald green beads around his neck, a snazzy
necklace of small cobalt blue beads around his neck, a temporary space station
reference device, a plain touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, an
asteroid hauling supply kit, and a large expandable telescoping xenology

Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a sleeveless buttercup yellow cotton top with a v-neck and a row
of tiny embroidered flowers at the edges, a pair of blue stonewashed denim jeans
with a small dark red 'XX' embroidered on the left front pocket, and a pair of
shiny buttercup yellow patent leather clogs. She is also wearing an orange and
white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny
tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer,
a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire
and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a
metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, a neon pink vibro-baton, and a
soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both
eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and both hands are left
uncovered.
She is carrying a large crystal gold-trimmed goblet of Cape Myers Paradise
Vineyards Pinot Grigio in her right hand.

She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely

straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall of loose curls
down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled crimson dragon pierces her belly button, a small enameled
cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe, and a small enameled cerulean
blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.

jeans with a small dark red 'XX' embroidered on the left front pocket, and a

orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard and filmy
deep purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and amethyst
flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it, a small oval turquoise
rattan table with a glass top, a large oval dark purple and light purple cloth
rug, a small seashell pink trash can, a small yellow ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy sapphire blue ceramic felo chow bowl, and a high
tech silver star print holovid here.
